review:
seeing the 40,000 negative reviews after one day of being released on steam is really really funny to me

honestly i miss original overwatch, ever since overwatch 2 came out u literally need to spend money for everything; battle pass, skins, fucking STORY MISSIONS. i think its bs. atp, fortnite is a better option.
This review will remain negative until they release Heroes of the Storm in Steam.

been playing ow since 2017 the game was good then and it is still good today - a few things that was promised and haven't been added and the whole f2p style blizzard swapped to was kinda ass but other than those things the game is still great and a very recommended game for new players who want to try a free class based shooter game that isn't tf2.
More like "Overwatch 2 bad you can't play Overwatch 1 anymore"

OVERHYPE 2: The Underwhelming Sequel

Oh boy, where do I even start with Overwatch 2? I guess you could say it's like that movie sequel that's all hype and no substance. I mean, did they accidentally swap their development team with a bunch of sleepy hamsters or something?

First off, I'd like to commend Blizzard for their unique strategy of releasing a sequel that looks suspiciously like the original game with a new coat of paint. I was expecting something revolutionary, but instead, I got a "new" game that felt like I accidentally stepped into a time machine and ended up in 2016.

The new heroes are clearly the result of some mad scientist's experiment gone wrong. It's like they let a group of kindergarteners draw random shapes and then turned those into characters. And don't even get me started on their abilities â€“ it's like they're trying to one-up each other in the "Who Can Have the Most Confusing Skillset" competition.

And the maps? Oh boy, the maps. It's like they decided to take a tour of the world's most generic locations and then slap an "Overwatchy" theme on them. I can't wait to play on the exhilarating "Abandoned Warehouse #47" or the heart-pounding "Generic European Village #12." Truly groundbreaking stuff.

But wait, there's more! Remember how they promised an epic story mode? Well, I hope you enjoy playing glorified tutorials with AI teammates who are about as useful as a screen door on a submarine. I've seen more strategic prowess from a pack of blindfolded squirrels.

And let's not forget the pinnacle of innovation: the microtransactions. Because what's the point of a sequel if you can't milk your players for all they're worth? I can already envision the "Golden Loot Box" containing the same duplicate sprays I've collected since the original game's launch.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is a masterclass in how to take a beloved franchise, suck out all the charm and originality, and replace it with a mishmash of recycled ideas. If you're into disappointment and a strong urge to play the first game instead, then by all means, dive right in. As for me, I'll be uninstalling this "sequel" faster than you can say "Blizzard, what were you thinking?"
